newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-KAISERSLAUTERN BEAT KAISERSLAUTERN IN CUP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-KAISERSLAUTERN BEAT KAISERSLAUTERN IN CUP.

text.p: Kaiserslautern beat their own amateurs 5-0 on Saturday in the most curious tie in the first round of the German Cup.
The amateur teams of big clubs often play in the Cup but Saturday's game was only the second time the draw had produced a match between a Bundesliga side and its own amateurs.
Kaiserslautern coach Otto Rehhagel, who effectively picked both sides as he has the right to draft amateurs into the first team, said he was satisfied with the result.
But he was not happy about the fact that one of the club's sides had to go out so early in the competition.
"Something should be done in the future to make sure there aren't matches like this," Rehhagel said.
A double from Czech striker Pavel Kuka and goals from Olaf Marschall, Juergen Rische and Brazilian Ratinho gave victory to the first team.

On Friday night Bayern Munich beat Waldberg 16-1 but Cologne and Borussia Moenchengladbach both lost to regional sides. Cologne went down 3-1 to Ulm while Moenchengladbach went out on penalties to Hanover.
